page.title: 09New Deer School
page.content: The school at New Deer was, until recently, a combined Primary and four-year Junior Secondary. When the new Academy opened at Mintlaw the Secondary department closed at New Deer. The school is now a{six-teacher {Primary School}with its{120 pupils}in seven year-groups taught in{composite {classes}for their first six years. The building has had some{renovation recently with new heating and canteen, and with accomodation being provided for{New Deer Pre-school Playgroup}(a voluntary organisation) in one of the old Secondary rooms. Secondary pupils are bused to Mintlaw Academy (10 miles away) except for a few who attend Ellon academy,Turriff Academy or schools in Aberdeen.
